𝗖𝗔𝗧𝗜𝗠𝗘 | A simple Windows countdown timer tool with Pomodoro clock functionality.  🔥 Super Hot!

♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦

𝗧𝗘𝗖𝗛 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗖𝗞: 💻 C 
🎯 𝗨𝗦𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗦𝗘: A simple Windows countdown timer tool with Pomodoro clock functionality.
📅 Created: Jan 2025 • Updated: Mar 2025

♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦

✨ 𝗞𝗘𝗬 𝗙𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗨𝗥𝗘𝗦 ✨

✅ Transparent interface
✅ Pomodoro clock functionality
✅ Customizable options (fonts, colors)
✅ Flexible timing (countdown, count up)
✅ Timeout actions (notification, lock screen, shutdown)


♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦

📊 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗧𝗦

⭐⭐⭐ 233 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘀
🍴 13 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀
🔍 11 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻 𝗶𝘀𝘀𝘂𝗲𝘀

♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

Catime is a simple and customizable countdown timer tool for Windows, designed with a transparent interface and Pomodoro clock functionality. It offers flexible timing options, a variety of customization settings for fonts and colors, and configurable timeout actions such as notifications, screen locking, or system shutdown. It is intended to improve focus and productivity.

♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦

🔗 𝗟𝗜𝗡𝗞𝗦
• 𝗚𝗶𝘁𝗛𝘂𝗯: https://github.com/vladelaina/Catime

𝗪𝗢𝗟𝗙 | Streaming virtual desktops and games running in Docker to multiple remote clients using Moonlight.  🔥 Super Hot!

✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿

🎯 𝗨𝗦𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗦𝗘: Streaming virtual desktops and games running in Docker to multiple remote clients using Moonlight.
📅 Created: Dec 2021 • Updated: Mar 2025

✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿

✨ 𝗞𝗘𝗬 𝗙𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗨𝗥𝗘𝗦 ✨

✅ Multi-user streaming of different content from a single host
✅ On-demand creation of virtual desktops with custom resolution/FPS
✅ Simultaneous use of multiple GPUs for different tasks (e.g., encoding and gaming)
✅ Low latency video and audio streaming with gamepad support
✅ Linux and Docker-first approach with containerized games
✅ Hackable configuration for encoding pipelines, GPU settings, and Docker/Podman details


✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿✿

🍴 55 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀
🔍 29 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻 𝗶𝘀𝘀𝘂𝗲𝘀

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

Wolf is a streaming server designed for Moonlight that enables multiple users to stream different games or virtual desktops from a single server. It supports on-demand virtual desktop creation, multi-GPU utilization, and low-latency streaming, all within a Linux and Docker-centric environment. The project prioritizes configurability, allowing users to customize encoding pipelines and GPU settings.

𝗝𝗘𝗧𝗦𝗢𝗡-𝗜𝗡𝗧𝗥𝗢-𝗧𝗢-𝗗𝗜𝗦𝗧𝗜𝗟𝗟𝗔𝗧𝗜𝗢𝗡 | Optimizing large models for deployment on NVIDIA Jetson devices using knowledge distillation.  🔥 Super Hot!

❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂

𝗧𝗘𝗖𝗛 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗖𝗞: 🐍 Python 
🎯 𝗨𝗦𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗦𝗘: Optimizing large models for deployment on NVIDIA Jetson devices using knowledge distillation.
📅 Created: Jun 2023 • Updated: Mar 2025

❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂

✨ 𝗞𝗘𝗬 𝗙𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗨𝗥𝗘𝗦 ✨

✅ Knowledge distillation from OpenCLIP to ResNet18
✅ Classification on the STL10 dataset
✅ Model profiling and optimization for NVIDIA Jetson
✅ TensorRT optimization
✅ Analysis of data, methods, and architecture impact on accuracy


❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂

📊 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗧𝗦

⭐⭐⭐ 175 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘀
🍴 9 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀
🔍 2 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻 𝗶𝘀𝘀𝘂𝗲𝘀

❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

This repository provides a tutorial on knowledge distillation, demonstrating how to transfer knowledge from a large OpenCLIP model to a smaller ResNet18 model for image classification on the STL10 dataset. It explores the impact of various factors like data, distillation methods, and model architecture on the final accuracy. The tutorial also covers model optimization using TensorRT for deployment on NVIDIA Jetson devices.

❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂

Dashy is a self-hosted dashboard application that allows users to organize their self-hosted services and applications in one central location. It offers features such as real-time status monitoring, widgets for displaying dynamic content, customizable themes and layouts, and various authentication options. Dashy aims to provide a user-friendly and efficient way to manage and access various self-hosted services.

GoAccess is a real-time web log analyzer that runs in a terminal or browser, providing fast and valuable HTTP statistics. It supports nearly all web log formats, offers incremental log processing, and requires minimal configuration. Its primary use case is to provide system administrators with a visual server report on the fly.

Tenere is a Rust-based application that offers a terminal user interface (TUI) for interacting with Large Language Models (LLMs). It supports multiple backends like ChatGPT, llama.cpp, and ollama, and provides features like syntax highlighting, chat history, vim keybindings and configuration options for a streamlined command-line LLM experience.

✅ Textual User Interface (TUI) via `ssht` command

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

SSHClick is a terminal-based tool for managing SSH configuration files. It allows users to easily list, filter, modify, and view SSH host entries. The tool supports grouping and metadata through comments and provides a TUI for interactive management.

Memos is an open-source, self-hosted note-taking solution built with Go and React.js. It emphasizes privacy by storing data locally and offers a lightweight yet powerful experience with Markdown support, customization options, and a completely free-to-use model.

𝗣𝗪𝗥𝗨 | Debugging network connectivity issues in the Linux kernel.  🔥 Super Hot!

❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀

𝗧𝗘𝗖𝗛 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗖𝗞: 💻 C 
🎯 𝗨𝗦𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗦𝗘: Debugging network connectivity issues in the Linux kernel.
📅 Created: Oct 2021 • Updated: Mar 2025

❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀

✨ 𝗞𝗘𝗬 𝗙𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗨𝗥𝗘𝗦 ✨

✅ eBPF-based network packet tracing
✅ Advanced filtering capabilities
✅ Fine-grained introspection of kernel state
✅ Support for kprobe and kprobe-multi backends
✅ Filtering by function name, ifname, netns, mark
✅ Tracing of TC and XDP bpf progs
✅ Tracking packets even after NAT or tunnel decapsulation


❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀

🔍 26 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻 𝗶𝘀𝘀𝘂𝗲𝘀

❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀❀

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

pwru is an eBPF-based tool designed for tracing network packets within the Linux kernel. It provides advanced filtering options and allows for detailed inspection of kernel state, enabling users to effectively debug network connectivity problems. The tool supports various kernel versions and tracing backends, offering flexibility in how packets are tracked and analyzed.
